intro: Gonolobus luteolus, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
